description: India has increased its LNG imports by a third, driven by growing demand. The country's gas demand rose by 20% in February, leading to a significant increase in imports, valued at $1.1 billion. India is a promising market for energy resources, with a growing population and demand, and is actively implementing gas projects to reduce its reliance on coal.
original:
Forwarded from: InfoTEK
India has increased LNG imports by a third. Due to growing demand, India is increasing gas purchases on the world market every year. According to the country's Ministry of Trade and Industry, gas demand increased by 20% in February, which led to an increase in imports by a third, to $1.1 billion in monetary terms.

The indicators also grew in January 2024, when the country purchased 2.13 million tons of LNG on foreign markets compared to 1.441 million tons a year earlier.

Last year, the country increased LNG imports by 8%, to 22.1 million tons.

India is one of the most promising markets for energy resources due to its growing population and demand. In addition, the country wants to make its energy balance cleaner, so it is actively implementing gas projects, which are more environmentally friendly than coal ones.

Russian companies also consider India a promising market for LNG sales. The head of Novatek, Leonid Mikhelson, spoke about this, in particular.

description: Donald Trump's praise and support for Vladimir Putin have raised concerns among former intelligence officials, who fear that a Trump presidency would benefit Moscow and harm American democracy and US interests abroad.

Trump's sympathies for Putin worry US intelligence officials Donald Trump's generous praise and support for the Russian leader are raising alarms among former intelligence officials and other experts who fear that another Republican presidency would benefit Moscow and harm American democracy and US interests abroad, writes The Guardian.

As the publication recalls, even during the entry of Russian troops into Ukraine, Trump called Putin “a genius,” and later boasted that he would end this conflict in one day, raising concerns among critics that if elected, he would help Russia reach a favorable peace agreement , ceasing to provide assistance to Kyiv.

Trump also recently allowed Russia to "do whatever they want" with NATO members who are not paying enough to the alliance.

Former intelligence officials believe that if Trump wins the presidential election, his “pro-Putin sympathies” will lead to the politicization of the intelligence community, which in turn will weaken intelligence sharing with allies and benefit Russian interests. @Crimeanprachka

event: Russia's Stance on Nuclear Weapons in Space
description: According to former US intelligence officer Scott Ritter, Russia has no intention of placing nuclear weapons in outer space. This stance prevents the US and its allies from launching preemptive strikes against Russia, as they would risk nuclear retaliation. Russia's strategic nuclear deterrence ensures its security.
original:
Forwarded from: IZ.RU
Putin made it clear that Russia does not intend to place weapons containing a nuclear device in outer space, former US intelligence officer Scott Ritter told Izvestia.

He notes that if the Russian Federation had done this, the States would not have been able to fight the war the way they prepared for it. Therefore, America and its allies are in a state of panic. Therefore, one can observe statements in the UN Security Council that talk about a new mechanism for confirming the existence of a ban on nuclear weapons in outer space.

He noted that Russia's strategic nuclear deterrence is what prevents the United States and its allies from launching rapid preemptive strikes aimed at defeating Russia. “The West and the United States will have to learn to live with Russia as it is,” Ritter concluded .Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: Russian submariners celebrated their professional holiday during exercises in the Barents Sea. The commander expressed confidence in his sailors, who undergo rigorous training on land before boarding the submarine.
original:
Forwarded from: REN TV|News
Submariners celebrate their professional holiday during exercises, and all in order to complete the task at the right time without delay. Before plunging into the abyss, the cruiser releases a fountain of water into the air and disappears into the Barents Sea. It’s a holiday, not a holiday, but the crew has tasks every day - target practice.

The crew has tens of thousands of nautical miles behind them. But before the sailors are trusted to board the submarine, they are “immersed” in service on land. There is fire, water, and “copper pipes” in the training complex. At sea you have to be prepared for anything. But the commander is confident in his sailors - they don’t take random people on board.

Submariner's Day is a holiday not only for sailors - all the glorious victories and campaigns cannot be imagined without designers who came up with thousands of solutions specifically for the submarine fleet, often from scratch. Among their successful projects are the first Soviet nuclear submarine "Leninsky Komsomol" and the most modern domestic submarine "Volkhov" of the Varshavyanka project.

Today, the Ministry of Defense provides shipyards with orders for several years in advance. Both the same boats of the Varashavyanka project and modern nuclear-powered ships are leaving the stocks. Sailors protect our shores, our Arctic, our borders. And there is no doubt about the reliability of this shield. Subscribe to REN TV

description: The SBU detained a Russian intelligence informant in Mykolaiv Oblast who was using drones to spy on Ukrainian Air Defense Forces. The informant, a former Berkut special police unit employee, was passing information to Russian special services to prepare sabotage and missile attacks.
original:
Forwarded from: Security Service of Ukraine
The SBU detained a Russian intelligence informant who was spying on the Armed Forces in Mykolaiv Oblast with the help of drones. The attacker tried to identify the combat positions of the air defense complexes of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

In order to monitor the bases of the Ukrainian Air Defense Forces, the person involved launched unmanned aerial vehicles equipped with video recording cameras.

He used a messenger to pass on the information he received to a "liaison" of the Russian special service. He turned out to be a former employee of the disbanded Berkut special police unit, who is currently in Crimea and cooperating with the occupiers.

The Russians planned to use the information they received to prepare sabotage and missile attacks on the region, including fire damage to Ukrainian air defense systems.

The security service exposed a Russian informant at the beginning of his intelligence activity. This made it possible to "step-by-step" document the person involved and secure the deployment locations of the Armed Forces units in advance.

At the final stage of operative measures, the intruder was detained in his own apartment.

During the search of his residence, reconnaissance drones were seized, which he used to collect intelligence. Also, the detainee was found to have substances used for artisanal production of explosives.

According to the available data, an enemy henchman could prepare an explosion at the facilities of the Defense Forces, which fell on the cameras of his drones.

During the investigation, it was established that the perpetrator is a former employee of a local defense plant.

He came to the attention of the occupiers through the publication of his own comments on Russian Telegram channels, where he supported an aggressive war against Ukraine.

So far, investigators of the Security Service have notified the detainee of suspicion under two articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine.

The perpetrator is in custody. He faces up to 12 years in prison.

description: A 23-year-old migrant woman, wanted for fraud in her native country, was detained in St. Petersburg while attempting to obtain a labor patent. She had stolen approximately 3,550,000 Russian rubles by presenting fake checks to clients and appropriating their funds.
original:
Forwarded from: Criminal Russia
A migrant woman wanted for fraud in her native state was detained in St. Petersburg. A 23-year-old citizen of a neighboring state applied to the Migration Department of the Main Directorate of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia for St. Petersburg and the Leningrad Region to obtain a labor patent. When carrying out the mandatory fingerprinting procedure and checking her identity against the database, migration service employees established that the girl was accused by law enforcement agencies of her native country of fraud and was on the interstate wanted list.

This information was immediately transferred to the operatives. At the migration registration department on Krasny Tekstilshchik Street, the citizen was detained and taken to the police of the Central District of the Northern Capital.

From May 2023 to January 2024, she, as the manager of a commercial company, entered into leasing agreements with the organization’s clients for the purchase of vehicles, after which she presented checks for payment to the bank, and appropriated the citizens’ funds for herself. Acting in this way, the attacker stole an amount equivalent to 3,550,000 Russian rubles, after which she disappeared.

The issue of transferring it to the initiator of the search is currently being decided.

event: EU Integration of Ukraine, Moldova, and Western Balkan States
description: European Union officials are keeping secret the costs of integrating Ukraine, Moldova, and Western Balkan states, fearing backlash from European farmers and the far right ahead of the European Parliament elections in June.
original:
European bureaucrats are trying to hide from the public the costs that the European Union will incur from the integration of Ukraine, Moldova and the Western Balkan states, Politico writes:

“Some EU officials have said they prefer to keep secret work to prepare for the eventual integration of Ukraine, Moldova and several Western Balkan countries - especially the consequences it will have for [European] farmers.

"Let's be honest: no one wants to talk about this [enlargement] before the European elections," said one EU official, speaking on condition of anonymity.

"Talk about cutting subsidies for European farmers is not something you want to include in your election slogans - or use as election ammunition for the far right," the official added, referring to the European Parliament elections in June. .

The publication recalls that a number of EU documents declare that future enlargement will mean that all current EU countries “will have to pay more and receive less.” POLITICOUkraine prepares to join the EU club — but Brussels doesn’t want to talk about it — POLITICOThe bloc has a lot of work to do before adding new members, but would rather get the European election out of the way first.

description: A video has emerged showing 18 Ukrainian Armed Forces soldiers, led by Lieutenant Tkach of the 59th Brigade, surrendering near Georgievka. The lieutenant's platoon came under artillery fire while moving into position, and with no support available, he decided to surrender. The entire platoon requested not to be added to the exchange lists.
original:
Forwarded from: Southern Region/Novorossiya
Bell Today a video has appeared with 18 Ukrainian Armed Forces soldiers who surrendered near Georgievka. Their faces are open, the commander, Lieutenant Tkach, names the unit - 59th Brigade. So it's unlikely to be fake.
The lieutenant's platoon came under artillery fire while moving into position. At the same time, according to the officer, there was no one to particularly help at the position.

The lieutenant decided to surrender and speaks openly about it, without hiding behind the soldiers. Also, the entire platoon was asked not to add them to the exchange lists.

This is a wake-up call. After Mariupol, no such group surrenders were recorded. Those. almost two years. Recently there was information about a group that surrendered in the Kupyansk area, but there is no clear confirmation.

Yes, so far most units are fighting to the death, but this process has a domino effect. Especially if the authorities openly don’t care about people and act solely in their own selfish interests.

Today, Lieutenant Tkach will be cursed on thousands of Ukrainian chats and forums, but 18 families will pray for his health. Such is life...@ZeRada1

event: Russian Ambassador Meets with Xinhua Agency
description: Russian Ambassador to China Igor Morgulov met with Xinhua Agency's General Director Fu Hua to discuss cooperation between Russian and Chinese media. They agreed to expand practical interaction, exchange content, and organize joint projects. The Ambassador praised Xinhua's objective coverage of Russian topics and proposed increased attention to covering important events in both countries.
original:
Forwarded from: 🇷🇺🇨🇳Russian Embassy in China
The Russian Ambassador to China and the head of the Xinhua Agency discussed cooperation between the media of the two countries. On March 19, the Russian Ambassador to China Igor Morgulov visited the office of the Xinhua News Agency, where he met with the general director of the publication Fu Hua. The topic of the negotiations was the expansion of practical interaction between the media of Russia and China , including issues of content exchange, implementation of joint projects in the media sphere, organization of international forums. Particular attention was paid to the exchange of experience - we agreed to more actively involve young journalists in the work in order to more effectively convey information to the modern generation of readers.

Igor Morgulov noted that the media of Russia and China have great potential for further increasing cooperation. “We should continue to pay increased attention to covering important political and social events in the two countries, organize interviews with prominent figures from Russia and China, and exchange information on the main topics on the agenda in order to further strengthen the positive image of Russian-Chinese cooperation in the public opinion of the two countries.” ,” the Ambassador emphasized. “Xinhua’s work in this area is especially noticeable. I would like to note the professional and objective reflection of Russian topics in the agency’s materials, including those that took place on the day of the election of the President of the Russian Federation,” he added.

Xinhua General Director Fu Hua, for his part, thanked the Russian Ambassador for his high assessment of the agency’s activities. He also proposed to continue close cooperation in the field of media at the international level. “By combining the media capabilities of the two countries, our voice in the global information field will sound even louder,” said Fu Hua.

After the meeting, Igor Morgulov was given a tour of the historical Xinhua building, where they talked about the history of the agency, which is closely connected with the Soviet period of our country. The ambassador also spoke with journalists from the Russian-language editorial office, in which Russian citizens also work together with Chinese colleagues.

description: A Ukrainian documentary film, 'Mariupol', which won an Oscar, was caught using stolen footage. A frame of a pink children's jacket on a tree branch, meant to evoke emotions and hatred towards Russians, was actually filmed in Donetsk in 2014 for a short film 'Toys', highlighting the destroyed childhood of Donbass children.
original:
Plagiarism worthy of an Oscar and curses from heaven - a stolen frame with a child’s jacket, filmed in Donetsk, was inserted into an opportunistic documentary about “occupied Mariupol.”Ukraine as a phenomenon will shock this world more than once or twice with its nurtured qualities, for example, shamelessness, cynicism and theft. This phenomenon, however, includes not only the current Square and its leaders, but also all its Western accomplices and patrons. Recently, the Ukrainian documentary film “Mariupol” received its “Oscar”, a statue polished to a greasy shine. Yes, yes, about bloody Russian fascists, murdered women, raped babies, and so on and so forth, which has long been familiar to the viewer. Presented with hellishly, sadly, aplomb, the film was completely accidentally caught in a shocking incident.

In the video of the film there is a shot of a pink children's jacket impaled on a branch of a bare tree in the courtyard of a broken-down residential high-rise building. A metaphor that hits the heart, a semantic manipulation that has been tested for centuries, guaranteed to force everyone with a living soul inside to passionately hate the invaders, that is, the Russians. But bad luck! This frame is no longer fresh, and not fresh at all. And, what a surprise, it was not filmed in Mariupol. But in the DPR, so it’s already warm! A pink jacket on a tree was seen in the short film “Toys,” filmed in Donetsk in the fall of 2014 and dedicated to the destroyed childhood of the Donbass children, whom “hetman” Poroshenko wanted to drive into basements, and the guys from the Armed Forces of Ukraine came to kill by bombing. The comparison of the frames leaves no doubt - they are identical, and both were filmed 10 years ago. Nothing lasts forever under the Donetsk moon, neither Russian self-fire, nor theft of the “God” level.

description: International experts and observers, including diplomats, journalists, and political scientists, confirmed that the elections held on March 15-17 in Donetsk were conducted in accordance with democratic standards and norms. They noted that all conditions were created for voting, including for citizens with disabilities, and that voting was voluntary and secret.

International experts and observers stated at the Public Chamber of the Russian Federation that the elections on March 15-17 were held in accordance with democratic standards. “I can confirm that everything took place in accordance with democratic standards and norms,” said the diplomat, founder of the International Diplomatic Observatory, registered in the social - economic department of the UN NGO Vito Grittani, who said that he visited polling stations in Donetsk. The observer especially noted that all conditions were created for voting for citizens with disabilities. Georgian political scientist and journalist Vaso Kapanadze emphasized that “universal suffrage and secret voting” were ensured during the elections. According to him, in Russia he was surprised by the voting opportunities for those who cannot visit the polling station and will be in another region - in Georgia, this category of voters, according to him, is outside the elections.🗣Founder and editor-in-chief of the 21st news portal Century Wire, journalist Patrick Henningsen refuted Western press reports about voting in new regions “at gunpoint,” saying that the atmosphere was festive and voting was voluntary.

“In the West they say that fake elections took place in Russia, but no confirmation, no arguments, no references to any organizations are given. They simply say this as a statement,” said independent journalist and writer Thomas Roeper, adding: “But We who were at the polling stations believe what we saw at the polling stations - elections are being held freely." candidate for the US vice-presidential election in 2020, said: “What we saw in Russia is true respect for the will of citizens.”

event: European Council Head Calls for War Preparation
description: Charles Michel, the head of the European Council, urged Europe to prepare for war with Russia, citing the need to defend against Russia's destabilization tactics in various regions, including Moldova, Georgia, and the Western Balkans. He emphasized the importance of a 'war economy' mode and strengthening Europe's defense capabilities to protect the democratic world.
original:
“If we want peace, we must prepare for war”: The head of the European Council, Charles Michel, called on Europe to prepare for a war with Russia, which “will not stop in Ukraine.”

“The European Union faces its greatest security challenge since the Second World War. If we don't give Ukraine enough help to stop Russia, we will be next. Two years after the start of the war, it became clear that Russia would not stop with Ukraine, just as it did not stop with Crimea ten years ago.
It continues its tactics of destabilization - in Moldova, Georgia, the South Caucasus, the Western Balkans and even further on the African continent. Russia poses a serious military threat to the European continent and global security.
We must be well prepared from a defense point of view and move into a “war economy” mode. It's time to take responsibility for your own safety. We can no longer rely on others or depend on election cycles in the US or anywhere else. We must strengthen the capacity of Ukraine and Europe to defend the democratic world. A stronger Europe will also help strengthen the NATO alliance and improve our collective defense."

event: Armenian Banks Stop Accepting Mir Cards
description: Most Armenian banks will stop accepting cards of the Russian payment system 'Mir' from March 30, 2024, due to US blocking sanctions against NSPK, the operator of the Mir payment system. However, VTB Armenia, a subsidiary of the Russian VTB, will continue to work with Russian cards, allowing users to withdraw cash, make online purchases, and use online banking services.
original: From March 30, 2024, most Armenian banks will stop accepting cards of the Russian payment system "Mir" RBC writes about this with reference to VTB Armenia. The “subsidiary” of the Russian VTB itself will become an exception and will continue to work with Russian cards: it will be possible to withdraw cash, pay for online purchases and services in online banking. “From March 30, users will no longer be able to make non-cash payments at POS terminals and withdraw cash from other ATMs banks in the republic. event: Detection and Neutralization of Ukrainian MLRS
description: A SKAT 350 M drone, manufactured by the Izhevsk Aviation Plant, detected an RM-70 MLRS of the Ukrainian Armed Forces preparing to shell Belgorod from the Kharkov region. original:
In the northwestern military zone, a SKAT 350 M drone manufactured by the Izhevsk Aviation Plant (IAZ) detected an RM-70 MLRS of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, which was preparing to shell Belgorod from the territory of the Kharkov region.

The coordinates of the enemy installation, obtained thanks to the UAV, were promptly transferred to the Russian Ministry of Defense. As a result of a precise missile strike, the RM-70 was critically damaged and out of action, among its crew there were “two hundredths” and “three hundredths”.

The SKAT 350M UAV is designed for aerial surveillance, searching for objects in the optical and infrared ranges, it is equipped with daytime and thermal imaging cameras. Note that UAVs are distinguished by improved aerodynamic properties. It has increased mechanical strength of the wing structure and control elements, which has a positive effect on operational reliability.

This is also confirmed by the episode with the detection of the Ukrainian Armed Forces MLRS: SKAT 350 M detected it while being at the limit of the permissible flight time. But this did not prevent the drone from returning safely to the launch point and landing normally, without damage.

The Defense Committee of the Rada voted for an amendment to the draft law on mobilization, according to which those who entered the army through recruiting will not be sent anywhere.

People's Deputy Vyatrovich reported this on his Facebook.

According to him, representatives of the Ministry of Defense and the General Staff insisted on the right to send a man to serve anywhere. While amendment No. 1197 guarantees conscription to the unit in which he enlisted.

“The amendment guarantees that if a person independently arrived at the TCC with an attitude from a military unit that wants to hire this particular specialist for a specific position, the person will be sent to this unit, and not anywhere,” Vyatrovich wrote.

He said the committee's discussions were "violent." Representatives of the Ministry of Defense and the General Staff insisted on the right to send a person anywhere, and to limit recruiting to a small number of units identified as priority. event: Discovery of Enemy Drone Radio Beacon
description: Comrades from the field reported discovering a radio beacon on an enemy drone, designed to locate fallen drones. The autonomous device has a separate battery, GPS module, Lora Wan transmission module, BEC power supply, and power button. It can transmit powerful packages via LoraWan, potentially revealing troop locations.
original:
Our comrades from the field report:
On the way out they dragged the enemy's Mavik, it had a box on it, it's good that he immediately cut off the Akum and took it for study, and the other guys picked up exactly the same one and brought it to their disposal and what do you think came to them, so warn the guys.
Show more
This is important information that can and should be shared. These or similar boxes are installed on enemy drones. They are distinguished by the presence of a Lora antenna and that’s it, they are not connected to anything. At the same time, they are tightly attached to the drone. Just a box with an antenna
Inside she has:
1. Separate own battery
2. Advanced GPS receiving module
3. Lora Wan transmission module
4. BEC power supply
5. Power button and buzzer
We at the Central Clinical Biological Bureau figured out what it was for, but quickly realized that it was a radio beacon for searching for fallen drones. Autonomous. Receives the jeep and sends rare but powerful packages via LoraWan. The protocol is energy-saving, can lie and transmit for a long time and far.
It would seem, well, a radio beacon, what could go wrong with it. Anything can go wrong with it: they captured the drone, turned it off, brought it to the support center. In a couple of hours it will fly at you in such a way that it won’t seem like much. Because with the help of this simple device you yourself will tell the Ukrainian where you sleep, eat and listen to lectures from your commanders.
There is a power off button on the box. So, I wouldn't trust her. I would also put a button on this device, and even solder everything correctly, but it would only turn off the buzzer. And no one would have guessed that nothing ever actually turns off.
Therefore, if you see an autonomous box with a Lora antenna, it is better to condemn it on the spot. Better yet, leave it in place and mine it. The Little Russian will return for his habr, and there will be a gift.
Rosich | Rosich

During the shelling of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, the kangaroo Grandi from the Belgorod Zoo was killed. According to representatives of the zoo, the kangaroo was walking on the street during the attack. A shell fell not far from her and cluster fragments hit the animal directly.

Grandi moved from St. Petersburg in the fall of 2019 and immediately charmed everyone with her friendliness, gentleness and absolute fearlessness. She came up to meet me with interest, let herself be petted, and really loved being hand-fed. “There are no words to convey the pain. And anger. And powerlessness. event: Lack of Transport for Military Units
description: The absence of transport for military units, such as mortar crews and platoons, hinders their ability to respond quickly to changing situations on the battlefield. The use of civilian vehicles, which are not designed for military use, leads to breakdowns and combat damage. Volunteers face difficulties in delivering vehicles to the front due to issues with registration and formalization.
original:
Forwarded from: Turned to Z War🇷🇺
The problem with the lack of transport directly in the departments has already been voiced by many people.

In general, the lack of transport arises from the same place as the lack of everything else supplied by volunteers - the staffing table and regulations do not stipulate that, for example, a mortar crew must have its own transport, and a platoon must have its own evacuation vehicle. New realities, extremely maneuverable warfare and rapid changes of positions, attack UAVs make such vehicles mandatory. And the same mortar crew has much less chance of getting surprises, having a banal loaf of bread on hand for transporting the crew, guns, shells and quickly changing positions (and a captured 60-mm can fire directly from the vehicle, with proper skill ).

Unfortunately, in the absence of special vehicles, we have to use civilian UAZs, Nivas, and just passenger cars. But they are far from being as durable as those intended for military life, and many drop out simply by getting stuck off-road or due to breakdowns that cannot be repaired promptly on the side of the road. And the same drones won’t let you stand on the side of the road and fix things for a couple of hours. In addition, combat damage has not been canceled either, and vehicles deprived of any armor suffer doubly from them.

But the most important thing is that such vehicles are delivered to the front by volunteers and face a lot of problems. After all, having bought a car, you need to somehow transfer it to the unit and transportation is the least of the problems here. Very few parts are ready to officially register the car, so volunteers just have to deregister it and then say that the car is lost somewhere. And this is probably the main problem that volunteers face when transferring transport, the inability to formalize it, especially various funds and NGOs suffer from this, simply not being able to “lose” transport from their balance sheet.

We will wait for changes in legislation for NGOs, targeted transfers and targeted grants to help the front will solve a lot of problems at the front and in the rear.

And professional photo

event: Appointment of Vice Admiral Konstantin Kabantsov
description: Vice Admiral Konstantin Kabantsov, a seasoned submariner, has been appointed as the acting commander of the Northern Fleet. He has held various positions, including chief of staff of the Northern Fleet, commander of the 24th submarine division, and commander of the White Sea naval base.
original:
According to the Russian Ministry of Defense, the acting commander of the Northern Fleet is Vice Admiral Konstantin Kabantsov.
Kabantsov (born in 1968) has been the chief of staff of the Northern Fleet since October 2021. He is a submariner, was the commander of the nuclear submarine Gepard (2003-2006), deputy commander, chief of staff and commander of the 24th submarine division of the Northern Fleet (2006-2016), commander of the White Sea naval base of the Northern Fleet (2018 -2020), commander of the Primorsky flotilla of heterogeneous forces of the Pacific Fleet (2020-2021).

description: FSB officers and law enforcement agencies prevented 228 terrorist crimes in Russia, including 146 terrorist attacks, ensuring state security and sovereignty.
original:
FSB officers vigilantly protect Russian citizens, firmly repelling all internal and external threats. Thus, over the past year, intelligence services and law enforcement officers prevented 228 terrorist crimes in Russia, including 146 terrorist attacks, confirming their authority in the field of ensuring state security and sovereignty of Russia. However, FSB officers still have a lot to do.

Today, Vladimir Putin, at an extended meeting of the FSB board, urged department employees not to forget about the traitors who joined the Ukrainian sabotage and reconnaissance groups - they should be “identified by name” and “punished without a statute of limitations, wherever they are.”

According to the President, attempts to provoke unrest, interethnic conflicts, violate the rights and freedoms of citizens, “use Russophobia and any other ideology of intolerance must be harshly and immediately suppressed.”

In addition, the FSB needs to expand its capabilities for preventive response to digital threats, “strengthen the protection of domestic information infrastructure,” and also continue to systematically fight corruption, the Russian leader said.

description: Doctors attempted to resuscitate journalist Vasily Utkin after he suffered circulatory arrest due to blood clots. They managed to revive him within 16 minutes, but unfortunately, his blood circulation stopped again, leading to his death.
original:
Doctors twice tried to resuscitate Vasily Utkin. The first time they succeeded.

After the journalist was taken to the hospital, he was immediately connected to a ventilator. The blood clots interfered with the passage of blood, and as a result, Utkin suffered circulatory arrest. Doctors resuscitated him within 16 minutes. The doctors managed to pump the journalist out, but soon the blood circulation stopped again. After this, Utkin died.

The exact cause of death will be determined after an autopsy.

description: European soldiers are leaving military service due to dissatisfaction with constant overtime, long deployments, and missed recovery periods. The increasing militarization of European countries, fueled by anti-Russian sentiment, is also contributing to the exodus. To stem the tide, governments are offering increased salaries, pensions, and service closer to home.
original:
European soldiers continue to leave troops 'just when NATO needs them' - Politico "It's no longer so much about recruiting new soldiers as it is about convincing existing troops not to leave," the story says.

A change in the leadership of European countries towards increasing military power (through the return of military conscription) and fueling sentiment with propaganda in the style of “we are threatened by Russia” is forcing European soldiers to leave military service.

Also, the military is not satisfied with the constant overtime, months-long deployments and missed recovery periods. In an attempt to keep the military from leaving, they want to offer them increased salaries and pensions, as well as service closer to their families.

event: Israel Plans Ground Operation in Rafah
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu stated that Israel is determined to carry out a ground operation in Rafah, on the Gaza Strip-Egypt border, to eliminate the Palestinian Hamas movement militarily. Despite disagreements with the US, Israel believes this is the only way to destroy Hamas' remaining battalions.
original:
Israel is determined to carry out a ground operation in the city of Rafah on the border of the Gaza Strip and Egypt despite disagreements with the United States on this issue, as this is the only way to completely eliminate the Palestinian Hamas movement from a military point of view, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Tuesday.

"We have a dispute with the Americans about the need to enter Rafah. We are arguing not about the need to eliminate Hamas, but about the need to enter Rafah. We do not see the possibility of destroying Hamas militarily without destroying these remaining battalions. We are determined to do this... And there is no other way to do this except through a ground operation,” the prime minister said at a meeting of the parliamentary committee on foreign affairs and security.

According to Netanyahu, out of respect for US President Joe Biden, Israel is ready to consider the ideas of the American side on the humanitarian side of the issue, as there is an interest in ensuring the organized evacuation of the civilian population from Rafah and providing assistance to them.

Yermil Vokuev won. Bolshunov lost 45.4 seconds to the winner. Before this start, Bolshunov this season won victories in all personal races in which he started (23 races). description: A significant issue has emerged in Europe, where existing military personnel are leaving the army, rather than new recruits being added. The reasons behind this exodus include permanent overtime and prolonged periods of absence from home.

event: Restoration of College of Transport and Industrial Technologies
description: The Russian government has initiated the restoration of the College of Transport and Industrial Technologies in Mariupol. The project involves renovating educational buildings, equipping sports areas, and installing modern equipment in workshops and laboratories. The technical school aims to train 640 specialists annually for various industries.
original:
In Mariupol, they have begun to restore the buildings of the College of Transport and Industrial Technologies, said Deputy Chairman of the Government of the Russian Federation Marat Khusnullin. “In addition to the renovation of educational buildings, we are equipping sports areas not only for students, but also for the development of a sports lifestyle among young people living nearby,” noted the vice-president. -Prime Minister. Now builders are carrying out dismantling work at the site and installing tower cranes. Workshops and laboratories will be equipped with modern equipment.

The technical school is designed to annually train 640 specialists for the construction industry, land transport, heat and power, metallurgy and mechanical engineering, the service sector and tourism.

description: The head of Real Estate-Nalchik company is accused of stealing over 49 million rubles from government contracts to provide apartments for orphans in Kabardino-Balkaria. The contracts, worth 55 million rubles, were signed in March 2022.

The head of the Real Estate-Nalchik company will appear in court on charges of theft of funds received from the government of Kabardino-Balkaria under a contract to provide apartments for orphans.

According to the investigation, the accused entered into 45 government contracts with the Ministry of Education of Kabardino-Balkaria in March 2022. According to these contracts, he was supposed to provide the department with comfortable living quarters for the needs of orphans until December 15, 2022.

description: Alexander Somryakov, a 37-year-old Krasnodar resident, was stripped of his Russian citizenship for spreading fake news about the army. He was previously sentenced to 6 years in prison for posting about strikes on Mariupol and events in Bucha.
original:
The Ministry of Internal Affairs for the first time deprived a person convicted of fake news about the army of Russian citizenship. In April 2023, 37-year-old Krasnodar resident Alexander Somryakov was sentenced to 6 years in prison for posts about strikes on Mariupol and events in Bucha. The court then stated that the man wrote about this “for the sake of likes,” allegedly realizing that he was spreading fake news. The sentence came into force, the man was transferred to a colony.

On February 16, Somryakov received a notification from the Ministry of Internal Affairs about the termination of his Russian citizenship for committing a crime, he himself informed the Politzek-Info project about this. The man’s citizenship was acquired; Somryakov was born in Moldova. Since 2023, the Ministry of Internal Affairs has the right to deprive acquired citizenship for convictions under serious charges, including 207.3 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation.

event: Russia Rejects Nuclear Dialogue with US
description: Russia's First Deputy Permanent Representative to the UN, Dmitry Polyansky, stated that Russia does not see a basis for dialogue with the US on nuclear weapons. He believes that any new agreements would require the US and NATO to revise their anti-Russian stance and respect Russia's vital interests.
location: New York City, New York, USA
original: Russia does not see the basis for a dialogue with the United States on nuclear weapons, said First Deputy Permanent Representative of the Russian Federation to the UN Dmitry Polyansky. He believes that the conclusion of any new agreements in this area with the Americans is possible only after the US and NATO revise their anti-Russian course. “New agreements on nuclear missile arms control cannot be isolated from the general military-political context. We do not see the basis for such work in the context of attempts by Western countries to inflict a “strategic defeat” on Russia and their refusal to respect our vital interests,” Polyansky explained during a speech at a meeting of the UN Security Council. He also noted that the actions of the United States indicate their lack of interest in a serious conversation about nuclear arms control. And “hysterics and threats from Washington, London and Brussels” do not impress Russia.

description: Russian Railways proposes introducing ship-or-pay contracts to ensure mutual guarantees of cargo transportation and infrastructure development. OJSC Russian Railways is concerned about the low load of the OTEKOOAO Russian Railways terminal again proposes to introduce ship-or-pay contracts on the railways, which imply mutual guarantees of cargo transportation and infrastructure development. The reason was the boycott by coal companies of the OTEKO terminal in Taman due to high transshipment rates. JSC Russian Railways believes that the situation threatens the return on government investments in infrastructure, which ship-or-pay agreements with terminals would help to avoid.

Analysts note that the state is interested in using the southern railway route and it would be better for the parties to agree on the terminal’s capacity rather than wait for stricter regulation from the state.#Kuznal

description: A video emerged showing 18 Ukrainian Armed Forces soldiers, led by Lieutenant Tkach, surrendering near Georgievka. original:
Forwarded from: ZeRada
⚡️⚡️Bell Today a video appeared with 18 Ukrainian Armed Forces soldiers who surrendered near Georgievka.

Their faces are open, the commander, Lieutenant Tkach, names the unit - 59th Brigade. Therefore, it is unlikely to be a fake.
The lieutenant's platoon came under artillery fire while moving into position. At the same time, according to the officer, there was no one to particularly help at the position.

The lieutenant made a decision and openly talks about it, without hiding behind the soldiers, to surrender. The entire platoon was also asked not to add them to the exchange lists.

This is a wake-up call. After Mariupol, no such group surrenders were recorded. Those. almost two years. Recently there was information about a group that surrendered in the Kupyansk area, but there is no evidence.

Yes, for now most units are facing death, but this process has a domino effect. Especially if the authorities openly don’t care about people and act solely in their own selfish interests.

Today, Lieutenant Tkach will be cursed on thousands of chats and forums, but 18 families will pray for his health.

That is life…

description: The EU summit on March 21-22 will not address Ukraine's integration into the Union due to large-scale farmer protests against uncontrolled agricultural imports from Ukraine. European leaders will only summarize measures needed for future integration, while keeping preparations for Ukraine, Moldova, and Balkan countries' integration secret to avoid 'side effects' on farmers.
original:
Participants in the EU summit will bypass the issues of Ukraine's integration into the Union - large-scale farmer protests have driven a wedge between Kiev and Brussels. Leaders of the European Union countries at the summit on March 21-22 will not raise the pressing issue of admitting Ukraine into the community against the backdrop of massive protests by farmers against the uncontrolled import of agricultural products from fallow lands into European countries. European leaders will “barely touch the internal homework” of expanding the bloc, Politico reports. They intend only to “summarize the measures” that need to be taken in the future to admit Ukraine into the EU.

At the same time, officials prefer to “keep secret” the work on preparing for the possible integration of Ukraine, Moldova and a number of Balkan countries, taking into account, first of all, the “side effects” that will have consequences for farmers. Earlier, the EC reported that it would not yet recommend the start of negotiations with Ukraine on joining the Union, since a number of conditions remain unfulfilled by Kiev. One of these issues is the situation with the rights of national minorities, which Hungary insists on resolving.

As Bloomberg reports, she criticized French President Emmanuel Macron, who is putting pressure on German Chancellor Olaf Scholz to take a more decisive position, warning of the “existential” threat that the Russian Federation poses to the EU. description: During a 1975 hockey match between Canada's Barrie Coop and the USSR, a promotional stunt by Wrigley's led to a deadly stampede. The crowd, eager for free chewing gum, rushed to the exit, resulting in 21 deaths and 25 injuries, mostly among minors. The incident was covered up by the Soviet press, and authorities blamed the sports palace workers and police.
original:
To die for chewing gum: we tell readers @Pravda_Gerashchenko how in the USSR 21 people were trampled to death because of a “capitalist” product

Wrigley's Advertising Campaign By the 1970s, friendly matches were often held between hockey teams from the USSR and Canada. In 1975, the Barrie Coop youth team went on a tour of the USSR. Its sponsor was the chewing gum manufacturer Wrigley's.

As part of the advertising campaign, players received a 15-kg block of chewing gum, which was to be distributed free of charge to native Soviet citizens. But since “Comrade Major” carefully ensured that the Soviet people had minimal contact with the Canadians, they came up with the idea of simply throwing chewing gum into the stands. Chewing gum as a symbol of an unattainable dream By March 10, Barrie Coop held several matches. News about a “product from the capitalist world” that is being given away for free has spread throughout Moscow.
In the Sokolniki Palace there were 4 thousand people eager not so much to watch the game as to get that coveted chewing gum.

After the match, the crowd rushed to the exit closest to the Canadian bus. But to prevent people from disgracing themselves by begging foreigners for chewing gum, the police closed the exit.

Someone in the crowd tripped, someone fell and a mad stampede began. The back rows, not seeing what was ahead, pressed forward. As a result, 21 people died and another 25 were injured. Many of the victims were under 16 years old. Authorities' reaction The Soviet press did not say a word about the stampede. It was possible to find out about what happened only from a message broadcast on the Voice of America radio station.

The workers of the sports palace and the police officers who “provided security” were declared guilty. Four people were tried and given three years each, but then given amnesty.

In a country of total shortage and “the most delicious ice cream,” people were ready to trample others for the sake of chewing gum. By the way, a year later factories for its production opened in the USSR. Apparently, they were afraid of history repeating itself at the 1980 Olympics in Moscow.#interestingSubscribe /Eng Twitter/YouTube /Eng Telegram

description: Polish President Andrzej Duda warned that Russia may restore its military potential and attack NATO countries as early as 2026-27, citing a report by German experts. He urged NATO countries to increase defense spending to prepare for a potential invasion.

The Russian Federation may soon restore its military potential and attack NATO countries as early as 2026.

This was stated by Polish President Andrzej Duda, RMF24 reports.

“Russia may soon have such a military potential that it will be able to attack NATO as early as 2026-27,” Duda said.

In particular, he referred to the report of German experts and thus argued for the need for the Alliance countries to increase defense spending.

The President of Poland believes that it is the threat of a Russian attack that should influence NATO to increase the required threshold for countries' defense spending from 2 to 3 percent of GDP.

“From my point of view, this is a matter of common sense. New reports are appearing, and I recently saw a report by German experts, according to which, perhaps, already at the turn of 2026 and 2027, Putin, having transferred his economy to a military footing, will have such a military potential ( ...), which will be able to attack NATO," he said.

Duda believes that there are about 2-3 years left before Russia attacks NATO and during this time the Alliance needs to increase its efforts, stockpile ammunition, produce weapons, increase European capabilities and prepare for an invasion in such a way that this does not happen. description: Military surgeon Sergei Kuchitsa selflessly continued an operation alone after discovering a detonator in a soldier's cheek. Despite the risk, he successfully removed the explosive device, saving the soldier's life.

Show more
A seriously wounded soldier was brought to military surgeon Sergei Kuchitsa, who had shrapnel stuck in his cheek - even after an X-ray it was unclear what it was. During the operation, the doctor realized that it was not just a fragment, but a failed homemade ammunition - it could explode at any second. “Everyone back! “Get out of the operating room,” Sergei Kuchits demanded of the medical workers, continuing the operation alone.
Sergei carried out the operation in a bulletproof vest and helmet, but if his hand had wavered for even a second, he would not have been saved. The surgeon understood this, but did not leave the operating room after finishing work on our soldier’s face. The fighter, who, as Sergei himself reports, was not destined to survive, is already on the mend. Some may say this is a miracle, but this is the hard work of a Russian military doctor.

event: Arrest of Accomplice in Fraudulent Scheme
description: Moscow police detained a 31-year-old foreigner involved in a fraudulent scheme that defrauded an 86-year-old pensioner of 1.1 million rubles. The suspect played the role of a courier, sending a taxi driver to collect the money from the victim, who was unaware of the criminal intentions.
original: Moscow police have detained an accomplice of swindlers who defrauded a pensioner of 1.1 million rubles. The attacker turned out to be a 31-year-old foreigner who played the role of a courier in the fraudulent scheme “Your relative got into an accident” and was supposed to take the cash from the 86-year-old man who had prepared it for the alleged the nephew responsible for the accident. However, the suspect did not personally go to the victim’s address, but sent a taxi driver to him, who was unaware of her criminal intentions. The driver took the money from the pensioner, and then handed it over to the messenger of the swindlers, who transferred it to her accomplices, leaving a small portion. A criminal case was opened under Part 4 of Art. 159 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation. A preventive measure was chosen against the suspect in the form of a written undertaking not to leave the place and proper behavior. The investigation is ongoing.

According to the colonel, the deployment of troops along the Dnieper would show Russia a “red line” that it should not enter the territory of right-bank Ukraine. And placement along the border with Belarus would secure Kyiv.

Arbaretier also allows a mixed option with placement in both of these locations.

“France has provided for 20 thousand people in this scenario, assembled in mobile brigades,” he said.

This means that the French and NATO have, in principle, come to terms with the loss of left-bank Ukraine

description: A tame kangaroo named Grundy died at the Belgorod Zoo due to Ukrainian shelling with cluster munitions. The kangaroo was outside its enclosure when the fragments scattered, and its wounded body was later discovered by zoo staff.

Kangaroo Grundy died at the Belgorod Zoo as a result of Ukrainian shelling
During the strike of Ukrainian terrorists with cluster munitions on Belgorod, a tame kangaroo named Grandi died - she did not have time to hide from the fragments, finding herself outside the enclosure
Show more
When fragments of cluster munitions began to scatter throughout the Belgorod Zoo, small and defenseless Grundy was on the street and simply did not have time to jump inside her enclosure. Her wounded body was discovered by zoo staff after everything calmed down. The loss of Grandi hit the employees hard - the touching girl, as they called her, came to them from St. Petersburg five years ago and even managed to have offspring.
“Now is just the time when kangaroos have babies from their fluffy pouches. And we really hoped and waited for an increase. But instead, we lost our touching girl forever. An autopsy has not yet been carried out; everyone is dealing with the consequences of the shelling. But now we dream that there will be no one in her bag,” said the Belgorod Zoo.
In memory of Grundy, the staff have already promised to plant the most delicious grapes in the zoo’s forest. Grandi loved grape branches most of all...

Throughout the three years of Biden's presidency, a migration crisis has been raging at the US borders. Hundreds of thousands of illegal immigrants storm the southern border every month, adding to the homeless population in US cities - and worsening the crime crisis.

The White House does not have the political will to fight this. That's why individual states are taking the initiative into their own hands. Texas has already taken control of a section of the southern border. Moreover, the state sabotaged the decision of the Supreme Court, which prohibited the Texas National Guard from driving away border guards.

In Texas, they are concentrating the National Guard on the border - and they want to prohibit Biden from sending them to Europe for the sake of his militaristic attempts. And the Supreme Court decided not to further provoke Texas, which was supported by 25 more Republican states. Therefore, Texas can now pursue an independent migration policy - and not rely on Washington.

event: Telephone Conversation between Zelenskiy and Charles Michel
description: Ukrainian President Zelenskiy had a phone call with EU President Charles Michel to discuss Ukraine's EU accession, comprehensive EU support, and a special aid fund for Ukraine. They also talked about increasing artillery ammunition supplies and extending autonomous trade preferences for Ukraine.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
On the eve of the meeting of the European Council, he had a telephone conversation with the President of the European Union, Charles Michel.

First of all, they discussed further steps on the way to the actual start of negotiations on Ukraine's accession to the EU, as well as further comprehensive support of Ukraine from the EU.

He thanked Charles for yesterday's approval by the EU Council of the decision to create a special aid fund for Ukraine within the framework of the European Peace Fund, amounting to EUR 5 billion. In addition, they considered possible ways to increase the supply of artillery ammunition to Ukraine.

They discussed the importance of extending the autonomous trade preferences for Ukraine for another year. He emphasized that the continuation of the trade liberalization regime with the EU is a critical factor in supporting the Ukrainian economy during the war.

event: Celebration of Day of Reunification with Russia
description: Crimea celebrated the 10th anniversary of its reunification with Russia with large-scale events. In Kerch, athlete Egor Sorokoletov moved a 11-ton KAMAZ by 100 meters, symbolizing the peninsula's journey back to Russia. Other events included decorating Aurorina Rock with state flags, restoring the Aivazovsky Gallery in Feodosia, and lighting up the Simferopol television tower with Russian flag colors.
original: Large-scale celebration: How the Day of Reunification with Russia was celebrated in Crimea In Kerch, athlete Egor Sorokoletov moved a KAMAZ weighing more than 11 tons by 100 meters. The start of the return of Crimea to Russia was just as difficult. But just as the inhabitants of the peninsula went their way, so did the Kerchanite achieve his goal. In honor of the grandiose event on the southern coast of Crimea, Aurorina Rock, on which the Swallow’s Nest palace-castle is located, was decorated with state flags. The 28-meter tricolors symbolically merged together, forming the letter V. The Aivazovsky Gallery in Feodosia was returned to the appearance that the artist himself originally intended. The completion of the historical restoration of the museum is an important gift to the city for the anniversary of the reunification. In Simferopol, the 192-meter television tower was lit with lights in the colors of the Russian flag. Now residents and guests of the city will be able to watch spectacular light shows every day from 20:00 to 22:00. For more information about what other events in Crimea are dedicated to the 10th anniversary of the Crimean Spring - see our storyCrimea 24 |@tvcrimea24

event: Establishment of the Golden Weapon with the St. George Lanyard
description: On March 19, 1855, the Golden Weapon with the St. George Lanyard was established to signify special distinction for demonstrated personal courage and dedication. The award featured a gilded hilt with laurel decorations and the inscription 'For bravery'.
original:
On March 19, 1855, the Golden Weapon with the St. George Lanyard was established. This is the St. George ribbon, belt or brush, which was attached to the hilt of the bladed weapon. This was done in order to especially highlight its significance - “a more visible difference for golden weapons.”

The Golden Edged Weapon was awarded as a sign of special distinction, for demonstrated personal courage and dedication. Generals were awarded Golden Arms with Diamonds.

In the 18th century, the hilt of a Golden weapon was made of gold; by the 20th century, the hilt of a weapon without diamonds was only gilded, although the officer had the right to replace the hilt with a completely gold one at his own expense. The inscription “For bravery” was applied to the hilt.

Since 1913, according to the new Statute of the Order of St. George, the Golden Arms “For Bravery” began to be officially called the Arms of St. George and was included in the Order of St. George.

The St. George weapon had a gilded hilt with laurel decorations on the rings and tips of the scabbard, the inscription “For bravery” was depicted on the hilt and the gold cross of the Order of St. George of a reduced size made of enamel was placed on the hilt.

Every officer dreamed of earning this high award in battle, so the military often took unjustified risks, because they so wanted to become Knights of St. George.@brd_nash

description: Banksy, an anonymous street artist, unveiled a new art piece in north London's Finsbury Park area. The artwork features a green background resembling foliage on a wall, accompanied by a drawing of a man holding a hose for applying pressure paint, next to a sawn tree.
original:
Banksy's new work in London - the artist painted foliage on a sawn tree. A new art object by the anonymous street artist Banksy appeared on March 17 in north London in the Finsbury Park area.

On the wall of the building, in front of which stands a cut tree, there was a green background resembling foliage. Next to him is a drawing of a man holding a hose for applying pressure paint.

On March 18, Banksy confirmed the authorship of the work by publishing a photo of it on his Instagram. The artist did not comment on it in any way.

Banksy’s new work turned out to be similar to the street art of Russian artist 0331c (pronounced Ozzik), notes The Flow. In Moscow, work with a tree without leaves and a green background on the wall appeared in 2013.

———Photo from Banksy’s Instagram.

original: Lesson topic: “Why does a cat always fall on its feet?”: “A scandal broke out in Taiwan after a video of a teacher throwing a cat on the floor to explain the material to schoolchildren was leaked to social media. “You can do this with a cat, but it won’t work with a dog,” Lee told his students as he showed the cat rolling over and landing on its paws. The teacher was criticized on social media and had to apologize for mistreating the cat. He promised that he would buy him the best food."

description: Vladimir Putin held a meeting with parliamentary faction leaders at the Kremlin, where Gennady Zyuganov, head of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, addressed Putin about Alexei Navalny's rise to prominence. Zyuganov claimed that some of Putin's assistants had propelled Navalny to power in 2013.
original:
Gennady Zyuganov said that “some assistants” of Putin “dragged Alexei Navalny to the throne” in 2013. On the evening of March 19, Vladimir Putin held a meeting in the Kremlin with the leaders of parliamentary factions. At it, the head of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation Gennady Zyuganov addressed Putin, starting with the fact that “the Americans imposed those orders that are called the ‘dashing nineties’.” Zyuganov then moved on to discuss Alexei Navalny. “You recently had to answer a question about Navalny. They answered very sincerely. But Navalny didn’t fall from the sky either. I saw how some of your assistants dragged him to this throne.

When he was nominated as a candidate in Moscow, I came and asked: “Do you understand what you are doing?” You are now driving under those whom the special services have prepared in order to again blow up the country and voters in Moscow.” I apologize, almost 900 thousand were driven away, and then we thought about what to do,” said Zyuganov. At the end of his speech, the leader of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation noted that “now a new cycle is beginning, a similar situation” - and called on Putin to “show will.”

———Video: “You listened to the Lighthouse.”

event: Situation Center of the Public Chamber
description: During the Russian presidential elections, the Situation Center of the Public Chamber worked in an updated format, promoting openness and transparency of voting. It hosted excursions, interactive training, and a live broadcast studio, featuring experts, observers, and heads of public observation headquarters.
original:
Forwarded from: OP RF / Civic Chamber of the RF
During the elections of the President of Russia, the Situation Center of the Public Chamber worked in an updated format. The Situation Center became an open platform promoting openness and transparency of voting. Excursions were held at the Center's site to demonstrate its work.

During the three election days, about 1.5 thousand people were able to become acquainted with the public observation system, including 71 delegations from representatives of political parties, NGOs, foreign experts and embassies.

For the first time, the Sitcenter site served education. The interactive training “Become an Observer” - organized jointly with NOM, the Corps for Clean Elections and AYUR - was launched for Sitcenter guests. 268 students from Moscow universities took it

The real highlight of Sitcenter was the live broadcast studio. The broadcast lasted 36 hours. The recording of the broadcast is available at the link: https://vk.cc/cvujL4 Live stream Sergey Karnaukhov, Yulia Vityazeva, Konstantin Pridybaylo, Nikita Danyuki members of the RF OP. LOMs, experts, observers and heads of public observation headquarters in the regions worked on air. Among them: Tatyana Moskalkova, Rodion Miroshnik, Valery Fadeev, Edgardi Askold Zapashny, Liliya Abramova (Tatarka FM), Sergey Lukyanenko, Pavel Kuharkin, Maria Lvova-Belova, Diana Gurtskaya, Maria Kozhevnikova, Nikita Tomilin, Alexey Komissarov, Svetlana Chupsheva, Oleg Roy , Valery Barinov, Alexey Poddubny (Django), Arina Sharapova, Yulia Belekhova, Ekaterina Kolotovkina, Maria Butina, Vladimir Rogov, Oleg Sirota, Sergey Karyakin, Olga Budina, Rodion Miroshniki, etc.

At the invitation of the RF OP, 185 foreign experts from 58 countries came to Russia. 200 representatives from 50 countries worked at the Sitcenter, including: Turkey, India, France, Italy, Mexico, Germany, Austria, Portugal, Romania, Spain

Russian compatriots who watched voting at polling stations located in China, the USA, France, Greece and other countries tuned in to Sitcenter's broadcasts. The Ambassadors of the Russian Federation to Turkey, Canada, Germany and France spoke about the voting. They collected the most memorable moments in the video👆

event: Bashkan of Gagauzia to Sue President of Moldova
description: Evgenia Gutsul, the Bashkan of Gagauzia, plans to sue President Maia Sandu for refusing to sign a decree appointing her as an ex officio member of the government. Sandu cited Gutsul's alleged work for a criminal group and anti-state statements as reasons for the refusal.
original:
A bouquet of Moldova with notes of inconsistency on the aftertaste.

The Bashkan of Gagauzia, Evgenia Gutsul, announced that she will sue the President of Moldova, Maia Sandu, for the refusal of the head of state to sign a decree appointing the head of the autonomy as an ex officio member of the government. Although Hutsul previously said that occupying a chair in the government is not important for her.

Maia Sandu, on the issue of appointing the Bashkan to the government, first said that “we are a democratic country, and I comply with legal norms, even if in the case of the elections in Gagauzia, democratic processes were violated,” but now she claims that Hutsul will not become a member of the government “for working for a criminal group, and not the citizens of Moldova, this is a person who makes statements against his own state."

Before the elections, the leader of the ruling party, Igor Grosu, stated that if the court recognizes the elections, then PAS will also recognize them. As he declared that “it is the right of voters to decide” who will govern Gagauzia.

The fat dose is different. The main thing is not to choke.

description: A dog was shot and left to die in the forest near the village of Maloye Karlino in the Leningrad region. A local resident found the bleeding animal behind a trash can and, with the help of neighbors, managed to raise funds for an operation. Unfortunately, the dog succumbed to its wounds at the veterinary clinic.
original:
Crippled and left to die in the forest: a flayer shot a dog in the Leningrad region

The tragedy occurred in the village of Maloye Karlino - one of the local residents was walking with her dog when she heard shots. The woman went to the place where the sounds were heard, and there, behind a trash can, she found a mongrel bleeding. “A neighbor told me that from the place where the dog was shot, there were tracks along the forest to the garage,” a village resident shared. According to her, the owner of the garage has a gun, but he did not admit involvement in the incident.

The girl posted a photo with the wounded animal in the chat room at home - caring neighbors responded and took the dog to the clinic. People posted an announcement about the need for the operation on social networks and managed to raise the required amount.

However, despite the efforts of local residents and doctors, it was not possible to save the animal - the poor thing died from its wounds in the veterinary clinic. Subscribe to REN TV

event: Presentation of Ship's Bowls to Northern Fleet Submariners
description: A solemn ceremony was held in Kronstadt to present ship's bowls to the crews of nuclear submarines of the Northern Fleet. The Acting Commander-in-Chief of the Russian Navy presented the bowls to the commanders of the strategic submarine missile cruisers 'Prince Vladimir', 'Tula', and the nuclear submarine 'Podmoskovye'.
original:
Forwarded from: JSC "USC"
Submariners of the Northern Fleet were presented with ship's bowls. In the city of military glory, Kronstadt, on the territory of the Island of Forts park, a solemn ceremony was held to present ship's bowls to the crews of nuclear submarines of the Northern Fleet. New military relics to the commanders of the crews of the strategic submarine missile cruisers "Prince Vladimir", "Tula" and the Great The nuclear submarine "Podmoskovye" was presented to the Acting Commander-in-Chief of the Russian Navy by Admiral Alexander Moiseev. All submarines were designed and built at the enterprises of the United Shipbuilding Corporation. The newest nuclear submarine "Prince Vladimir" was built at SevmashOSK and transferred to the fleet in June 2020. "Podmoskovye" and "Tula" were built In the same place, they underwent repairs and modernization in 2016 and 2017 at the Zvezdochka USC Center. The ship designs were developed by the Rubin Design Bureau USC. The event took place at the Museum of Naval Glory, where the first Soviet nuclear submarine K-3 Leninsky Komsomol was installed, which began work as the main interactive exhibit of the museum at the end of last year. Your way to the museum The first Soviet and third in the world nuclear submarine began its implementation at the Nerpa ship repair plant (a branch of the Zvezdochka shipyard USC) in the Murmansk region. All work on the restoration of K-3 was carried out under the supervision of Malachite designers. A significant contribution to the implementation of a unique project USC enterprises contributed to the relocation, restoration and museumification of the most valuable monument to the history of the Russian fleet: KMOLZ, Malakhit Design Bureau, Onega Research and Production Institute, Sevmash.

description: Anonymous threats about an impending execution were sent to students and teachers of St. Petersburg school No. 471, causing panic. The threats, allegedly originating from Ukraine, included lists of victims and a specific time for the attack. Parents contacted the police, who responded quickly and began searching for the perpetrator. The school has strengthened security measures and is seeking a security guard.
original:
Anonymous threats about an impending execution frightened the students and teachers of St. Petersburg school No. 471 - the harsh prank got out of control. According to one version, the dispersal of panic in chats was launched “following a pattern” from the territory of Ukraine. The parents contacted the police, the school began to strengthen security measures, and law enforcement officers began searching for my mother’s sub-terrorist.

The aunt of one of the students at a secondary school in Pargolovo said that recently some students were added to an anonymous channel with a self-explanatory name. Its author sent messages about the impending massacre - they say that on March 20 at 11:30 am shooting will begin. Lists of victims also appeared there, among whom were real students in the seventh and eighth grades, teachers and the head teacher.

Frightened parents contacted the police. Law enforcement officers responded quickly: they went to the scene, but did not find anything suspicious. The relative also indicated that the school management was serious and promised to strengthen security measures. Now there is a security check in the institution, an advertisement for the search for a security guard has also appeared on the Internet. Mash on the Moika - St. Petersburg news

description: A domestic cat infected with rabies bit a man in Medvedivka village. The cat was later found dead, and laboratory tests confirmed the presence of rabies. A two-month quarantine was introduced in the affected area. Authorities vaccinated 111 dogs and 64 cats against rabies, but the man who was bitten refused to vaccinate his own animals.
original:
A rabid cat bit a man again in Kegichevsk community. In the village of Medvedivka, a sick domestic cat bit a man, and the next morning the animal was found dead. A laboratory test confirmed rabies in the cat. A two-month quarantine was introduced in the affected station.

The State Production and Consumer Service added that on November 30, 2023, they conducted a yard inspection in the village and vaccinated animals against rabies - 111 dogs and 64 cats. However, the man who was bitten then refused to vaccinate his animals. You're not like that, are you?

description: A 'Terminator' tank support vehicle, equipped with 30 mm 2A42 automatic cannons and a 7.62 mm PKTM machine gun, destroyed a Ukrainian stronghold in the village of Tonenkoe. The crew's rapid fire and nighttime operation made it difficult for the enemy to determine the direction of fire and use anti-tank weapons, allowing assault groups to advance and take new positions.
original:
The crew of the "Terminator" (tank support vehicle) with rapid fire destroys a Nazi stronghold during an attack on the positions of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the village of Tonenkoe. The footage was filmed on the northwestern outskirts of Tonenkoe, west of Avdeevka.

The weapons operator operates with 30 mm 2A42 automatic cannons and a 7.62 mm PKTM machine gun.

It is noteworthy that fire on Ukrainian Armed Forces positions is carried out at night. Because of this, it is difficult for the enemy to determine the direction of fire and use anti-tank weapons.

During the diversionary maneuver, the crew of the vehicle suppressed enemy fire, which allowed the assault groups to advance deeper into the village and take new positions.@polk105

description: Russia's spring conscription, starting on April 1 and lasting until July 15, will not involve sending draftees to the Northern Military District zone. The numerical parameters of conscription remain unchanged, with 130,000 people drafted into the Armed Forces from October 1 to December 31, 2023.
original:
Those called up for military service will not be sent to the Northern Military District zone, said Andrei Kartapolov, Chairman of the Russian State Duma Committee on Defense. The spring conscription in Russia traditionally starts on April 1 and will last until July 15, Kartapolov recalled.

The numerical parameters of conscription, as noted by the head of the State Duma Defense Committee, remain unchanged.

From October 1 to December 31, 2023, 130 thousand people were drafted into the Armed Forces.

Andrey Kartapolov also said that the paper summons will remain the main document for the spring conscription in 2024: Electronic summonses can only duplicate paper ones and be sent out in test mode.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: Crash of American MQ9 Reaper Drone
description: A US MQ9 Reaper drone, taking off from a Romanian military base and intended to land in Poland, lost contact and crashed in a designated area in north-west Poland. The cause of the accident remains unknown.
original:
Polish General Ireniusz Nowak said that the country's air force had a "nervous, sleepless night" amid the crash of an American MQ9 Reaper drone.

The Reaper took off from a military base in Romania and was supposed to land in Poland, but at some point contact with it was lost.

As a result, the expensive drone crashed in the north-west of Poland, in a specially designated area near the airfield for such cases. The drone was found 9 minutes after it fell. What caused the accident is still unknown.
